CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Such improvement could result from stronger intermolecular interactions , expanded absorption range , and better molecular planarity of selenophene contained PSeBDDIDT.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| selenophene |
| PSeBDDIDT |

Note: I am assuming that "PSeBDDIDT" is a material name, as it is not explicitly clear from the text. If it is not the case, then there are no material names in the given paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Such improvement could result from stronger intermolecular interactions , expanded absorption range , and better molecular planarity of selenophene contained PSeBDDIDT.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| stronger intermolecular interactions |
| expanded absorption range |
| better molecular planarity |

The three "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are "stronger intermolecular interactions," "expanded absorption range," and "better molecular planarity." These entities are the properties that could be improved in PSeBDDIDT containing selenophene.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| expanded absorption range |
| better molecular planarity |

After reviewing the paragraph, I have identified two "Property Name" entities that clearly refer to material properties: "expanded absorption range" and "better molecular planarity." The other entity, "stronger intermolecular interactions," is not a material property, but rather a type of interaction that can contribute to the improvement of material properties. Therefore, I have removed it from the list.
